alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin; Crane; Lower Brewster County; Marfa Plateau; Pecos; Presidio Valley; Terrell; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 28 at 4:43PM CST until March 01 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR MUCH OF THE PERMIAN BASIN, UPPER TRANS PECOS, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, AND THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR MUCH OF THE PERMIAN BASIN, UPPER TRANS PECOS, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, AND THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ TO 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ WEDNESDAY FOR WARM, DRY, AND WINDY CONDITIONS AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND WEST TEXAS... * TIMING...Late Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph across the lower elevations, and 35 to 55 with gusts to 75 mph across higher elevations. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 6 percent. * RFTI...5 to 8 or critical to extreme. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Central Brewster County; Chinati Mountains; Chisos Basin; Crane; Lower Brewster County; Marfa Plateau; Pecos; Presidio Valley; Terrell; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
